docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 9 (U.P.) -- Argentina's neighbor States moved swiftly to recognize her new revolutionary government tonight, forty-eight hours after President Pedro Ramirez's official bid for closer relations with the solidly anti-Axis...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 9 (U.P.) -- Argentina's neighbor States moved swiftly to recognize her new revolutionary government tonight, forty-eight hours after President Pedro Ramirez's official bid for closer relations with the solidly anti-Axis nations of the Western Hemisphere.

headline.main: 4 NATIONS ACCEPT ARGENTINE REGIME; Neighboring States of Brazil, Chile, Paraguay, Bolivia Accord Recognition

docs.snippet: ALGIERS, June 9 -- The French Committee of National Liberation expects joint recognition by the American and British Governments of its status as trustee for the French people, the representative of French interests in the conduct of the war and the...
docs.lead_paragraph: ALGIERS, June 9 -- The French Committee of National Liberation expects joint recognition by the American and British Governments of its status as trustee for the French people, the representative of French interests in the conduct of the war and the government of the empire.
docs.abstract: US and Brit recognition awaited; Churchill views cited; L Perillier apptd Interior Under-Comr; Uruguay announces recognition; conflict on Giraud status discussed; high mil command planned

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 10 -- A draft agreement for a United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration was submitted by the State Department today to the governments of all the United Nations and of the other countries associated with them in the war.

headline.main: U.S. OFFERS PLAN FOR WORLD RELIEF; Draft Agreement for Central Agency to Aid Needy Peoples Is Sent to United Nations

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 11 -- In a simple ceremony in the Foreign Ministry at noon the United States, Great Britain, Canada and most of the States of this continent that had not done so before formally recognized the new Argentine government...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 11 -- In a simple ceremony in the Foreign Ministry at noon the United States, Great Britain, Canada and most of the States of this continent that had not done so before formally recognized the new Argentine government headed by General Pedro P. Ramirez.

headline.main: ARGENTINE REGIME RECOGNIZED BY U.S.; Also Britain, Latin Americans, Other Countries Make Formal Contacts With Ramirez HULL EXPLAINS OUR ACTION Secretary Says It Was One of the Usual Steps After a Change in Government

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESIBy Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 14 -- An official communiqu issued by the Foreign Ministry announced tonight that the decree prohibiting the use of secret codes in international wireless communications has been temporarily suspended, but will return...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 14 -- An official communiqu issued by the Foreign Ministry announced tonight that the decree prohibiting the use of secret codes in international wireless communications has been temporarily suspended, but will return into force again at midday on Wednesday.
docs.abstract: Mm Storni ready to sign pact with US to get machinery and in turn supply oil to neighboring countries

headline.main: ARGENTINA EASES BAN ON USING CODE; Restriction Lifted Until Noon Tomorrow to Allow Some Messages to Clear BUENOS AIRES EXPLAINS Republic Now Awaits Pact With U.S. to Get Machinery in Deal for Petroleum

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 17 -- Dr. Seymour Harris, member of the faculty of Harvard Business School, currently on leave to the Office of Price Administration as head of that war agency's export-import price control, will leave shortly for South America,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 17 -- Dr. Seymour Harris, member of the faculty of Harvard Business School, currently on leave to the Office of Price Administration as head of that war agency's export-import price control, will leave shortly for South America, where he will discuss price controls with officials of the governments of several of the nations there, it was learned today.
docs.abstract: To conf with South Amer govt officials on price controls

headline.main: OPA AIDE TO ADVISE LATIN COUNTRIES; Dr. Harris Will Help Them on Price Control -- Other War Agency Actions

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: FROM J.G. Young, Director General of the General Post-office in Wellington, have come photographs of the 1943 "Health" semi-postal stamps to be released by New Zealand in October and to be withdrawn from sale not later than the end of next February.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 25 (U.P.) -- The Buenos Aires police, in a surprise move, have closed the headquarters of a pro-Allied Argentine women's organization and ordered a halt to the activities of other volunteer groups preparing bandages and...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 25 (U.P.) -- The Buenos Aires police, in a surprise move, have closed the headquarters of a pro-Allied Argentine women's organization and ordered a halt to the activities of other volunteer groups preparing bandages and other medical supplies for the Allied forces, reports reaching here from the Argentine capital said tonight.

headline.main: ARGENTINA CURBS PRO-ALLIED GROUPS; Headquarters of Women's Aid Committee Closed by Police
